title: 110_s3138
content: The Act titled "Do-Not-Text Act of 2008" exempts certain qualifying messages from being classified as mobile service commercial messages. The CAN-SPAM Act of 2003 defines a mobile service commercial message as a commercial email sent directly to a wireless device used by a subscriber of commercial mobile service. It excludes messages that facilitate, complete, or confirm a previously agreed-upon commercial transaction. The CAN-SPAM Act of 2003 excludes mobile service commercial messages that provide warranty, product recall, safety information, or notice of changes in ongoing commercial relationships. The CAN-SPAM Act of 2003 excludes mobile service commercial messages that provide information related to ongoing commercial relationships, account balance information, employment relationships, or related benefit plans. The CAN-SPAM Act of 2003 excludes mobile service commercial messages that provide information related to ongoing commercial relationships, account balance information, employment relationships, or related benefit plans. Additionally, the Act allows for the sending of phone-to-phone short messages and mobile service commercial messages by providers of commercial mobile service. The CAN-SPAM Act of 2003 allows providers of commercial mobile service to send mobile service commercial messages to subscribers for free, unless a subscriber opts out. SEC. 3. PROHIBITION ON UNAUTHORIZED MOBILE SERVICE COMMERCIAL MESSAGES CONTAINING UNSOLICITED ADVERTISEMENTS. Prohibition on unauthorized mobile service commercial messages containing unsolicited advertisements is amended to include sending messages without prior authorization. Definitions are also updated to include the term 'mobile service commercial message'. The term 'mobile service commercial message' is defined in the CAN-SPAM Act of 2003. A rule of construction clarifies that the prohibition on unsolicited messages does not apply to phone-to-phone short messages or mobile service commercial messages sent by providers to their subscribers at no cost unless the subscriber opts out. The CAN-SPAM Act of 2003 defines 'mobile service commercial message'. Providers can send these messages to subscribers at no cost unless the subscriber opts out. SEC. 4 of the CAN-SPAM Act explicitly prohibits unsolicited advertisements sent to cellular telephones. The Federal Trade Commission will revise the do-not-call registry provisions to prohibit sending commercial messages to numbers on the registry assigned to commercial mobile services. The term "commercial mobile service" is defined in section 332(d) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 332(d)).
